review_text: Our second stay there in the last 2 years, so that should say a lot! Interior space was fun & funky; made me think of my artsy girl friends places back in college who knew how to make old, quirky abodes an art-filled delight. The building is an old storefront on the groundfloor with a walk-up apartment above. Everything is well maintained & upgraded. Loved the clawfoot tub! The area has plenty of cool restaurants, bars & cafes withing walking distance. The Lake is an easy walk, too. You'll enjoy this place!

Group trip
review_text: Tina’s place was fantastic. Easy access on foot to everything cool about Sheboygan. Great music, nightlife, cafes and restaurants nearby. The place itself was very creatively rehabbed, with lots of modern amenities, but not HGTV-overdone. It’s an apartment over an old storefront, and most of the old fixtures—like the old solid wood doors & floors—are still there, just restored tastefully. Tina has a very artful eye that she has tastefully applied to the interior decoration here—quite a treat for anyone lucky enough to stay here!

name: Tim
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
This is a place of trade-offs. It's in a great, central location in town, within walking distance to the lake and downtown. But that same central location tended to attract a bit of noise on some days, even in the middle of the night. I stayed long enough to get used to it. Additionally, since it's on a main street in town, street parking is not free on weekdays. But I managed to find street parking on a quiet road a block south, not too far away (within visual of the kitchen window). Again, I got used to it, because the benefit of the good location outweighed it for me.
However, if you do visit in the summer, know that using the rear bedroom might be a hot experience for you. The kitchen radiates heat, which essentially cuts off that bedroom from the rest of the air circulating through the apartment, even if the A/C in the living room is on and/or the windows open.
But all that aside, you should have all that you'll need. I stayed an entire week (spending most of the daytime out and about), and I had no reason to need anything else.

Tina’s place is great. We (2 couples) were visiting the new Kohler museum (highly recommended) and this apartment was perfect for us. Very clean, orderly, and quirky. It has a lovely back yard and deck, which was perfect for eating breakfast.
We were there on a Saturday night - the parking is free but the bar across the street was loud. Tina thoughtfully provides ear plays and a white noise machine to address the situation.
Tina was quickly responsive to my questions and gave us good advice about restaurants.
Five stars from me; highly recommended.

Tina is spot on with the communication and any help about the place. this apt is filled with personal touches, nice decor and compact place in the middle of downtown with access to everything. 15 mins is your max drive to any place from here. bookworm garden, rail museum, Starbucks, eatouts, ice cream shops, boardwalk etc. the bar nextdoor can be heard, but if you are tired after beach visit it's not heard :) Tina was polite in her communications and tips abt the place. linens and beds were clean. super hot shower with toiletries as well. enjoy shebogyan and stay here to save drive time and get a personal touch of home away from home.
Thank you !

name: Andy
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
July 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Excellent communication from the host, everything was as-described and pictured. It felt safe and got the job done.
The apartment is definitely an eclectic space put together with a lot of love — local crafts on display (and for sale), a corkboard wall full of “thank you” notes and snapshots, a TV stand made from an old suitcase with an oar for a leg — the decor and age of the building are charming to many, but might ruffle the feathers of a strict minimalist.
It is centrally located and close to everything — as is the case with much of Sheboygan. Michigan Avenue is a little bit of a busy street, and the next-door neighbor is a hardware store, but it wasn’t too loud during our stay. The free ear plugs provided by the host were a nice touch.
Pro tip: Remember to bring some coins for the metered street parking on weekdays until 5 PM :) $0.50/hour.

On the Sat. night we stayed there were loud teens or young adults in the streets until after 2AM, but otherwise a fairly nice location. The stairs up to the apartment may be tricky to navigate for anyone with mobility issues.

Stayed one night
review_text: We loved our stay at Tina’s apartment! Such a charming, warm place above a quiet (silent, really!) storefront - who hasn’t always had that dream of the apartment above a quiet local shop? Eclectically decorated to support local artists - a sweet touch and great way to pick up a local souvenir! Living room was cozy and comfortable for an evening TV show and the Sunday morning news. We didn’t get a chance to visit the neighborhood, but if local pubs are your style, you are in for a treat! Across the road from one of the highest rated craft beer bars in the area - we truly can’t wait to come back and explore more of this neighborhood and Sheboygan! Tina’s apartment is a great place to stay for exploring or for staying in and enjoying a cozy Wisconsin evening.

review_text:
Tina’s apartment is the kind of place I dream about living in... cozy and comfortable, unique and stylish, artistic flourishes throughout, walkable to waterfront, shops, restaurants. Tons of character, from both the building and its caretaker. The pictures truly don’t do it justice. Parking in front is metered on weekdays, but there was plentiful free neighborhood parking when we arrived late Friday afternoon.
We loved Paradigm for coffee and relaxation, Urbane for cocktails, Toy’s Thai and Laotian for exceptional pan-Asian cuisine (note: very, very leisurely!). Wonderful service at Rendezvous French restaurant right across the street. The Kohler Art Center is always packed with memorable exhibits. Short drive to Kohler-Andrae to walk the cord walk boardwalk along Lake Michigan.
We found the noise of being in an urban area in line with, well, the benefits of being in a urban area! I didn’t hear much after late dinner hours, but the ear plugs and white noise machine Tina thoughtfully provided were welcome in the event that we encountered a noisier evening.
We love Sheboygan, and hope to stay at Tina’s again!

I stayed at Michelle's place for a conference I was attending in Sheboygan.
The days were so long that I was really only there to sleep.
(But I hope to get back to the area in the future to explore the beaches and hiking!)
The house was exceptionally clean and was very scent neutral, which, as someone with multiple chemical sensitivities, I appreciate! I was also grateful that the linens were washed in unscented "free and clear" type detergent.
Despite the house being on an alleyway and close to other houses, I had absolutely no problem with noise whatsoever. And I am a very light sleeper and sensitive to noise.
For me, this airbnb checked all the important boxes: clean, quiet and a friendly and informative host.
Thank you!

When I canceled Airbnb offered to give me $70 dollars back for late cancelation. Since I didn't have much choice, I took what I could get. Shortly after I got a response that Michelle had returned all of the money I paid, $314 in total. I would have understood if she had kept it as the possibility of rerenting would be difficult. I am very gracious for that and will find a reason to rent from her in the future! There are still good people out there :)

Negatives: Small TV with some channels missing (e.g., we couldn't watch the Bucks game that was playing), slanted wood ceiling in the main bedroom/bathroom that you might bump your head on if you're not careful, very steep stairs to the top floor.
Overall impression - positive!

review_text: The Nest has become an annual tradition for our family. We spent our days at Kohler Andrae and then headed "home" for quiet evenings. Peaceful, clean, and well stocked with both essentials and extras, Mikki has made this a great place to stay! House is located on a quiet, residential street - no loud traffic or consistent foot traffic. Walking distance to a convenience store if needed. Quick drive to local restaurants as well as the state park and the waterfront.

name: Beth
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place is a gem. My family found it to be a peaceful and exceptionally clean home away from home while we were in town for a funeral. You’ll find a well-stocked full kitchen with table seating for six, comfy living room furniture, little extras in the bathroom like toothpaste and shampoo, good WiFi, reliable air conditioning, great water pressure in the shower, a mini book and games library, and blackout curtains for early summer sunrises, all in a cute city neighborhood. Visitors with more free time than we had will appreciate the area guide book and collection of restaurant menus as well. The icing on the cake was the outdoor fire pit and chairs. It really felt like home. We were three adults and I think the small home would be best for a maximum of four adults (although there is a daybed that would sleep a fifth). The main floor bed’s mattress is much firmer than the upstairs bed, so take that into consideration when picking a room. I would not hesitate to book this house again in the future.

review_text: I have stayed at a lot of Airbnbs, and this was one of the best ever. It is even better than the photos show. Incredibly warm and welcoming, with so many extra nice touches and decor. It was convenient to Lambeau for the soccer game my daughter and I came to see, and lots of fun things to do in the area. Mikki’s communication and help was extraordinary! Wish we could have stayed longer to just hang out at the house and enjoy more of it. Will definitely come back, and highly recommend staying here.

review_text: Michelle is a wonderful host. Her little house is a jewel; newly renovated, immaculate, cozy and inviting. Her thoughtful touches abound. The neighborhood is a Norman Rockwell blast from the past; scrubbed and loved, peaceful and welcoming. This is an old-fashioned (in the best sense), small-city, middle class residential neighborhood where everyone takes obvious, justified pride in their home and their surroundings. Even the alleys are just as tidy as can be. I'd go back in a heartbeat. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Stayed with kids
review_text: We highly recommend a stay at "Logan's Nest" if your travels bring you this way. It was absolutely perfect for our Sheboygan Holiday. It really helped us to work out the logistics with other family in the Milwaukee and Green Bay areas. The place was just what we needed and well located for our beach and museum excursions. It was a perfect place to relax on the deck or around the fire pit after our running around. All in all, it was a great couple days and we loved our stay. A couple things to be aware of. There is only an accordion door to block the basement stairs and the child gate provided is rather flimsy. The other thing is the stairs going to the upper level are very narrow and should be approached with caution. Despite these couple of things, the place had everything we needed and we would certainly stay here again.

name: Lisa
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is our go to house to stay in when in Sheboygan. We like walking, and the neighborhood is lovely to walk around. We also walked to Three Sheeps, downtown, and the lake. Downtown is about a 20 minute walk, and a couple minute drive. Mikki has some lovely touches, like the plastic kids plates and cups, and both a drip and Kurig coffee maker. Three of us typically stay in the house, and we have plenty of room. We have family in the area who come over, and there is plenty of room for them as well. There was plenty of wood for the family to roast marshmallows in the fire pit. There was even wood stacked in the fire pit when we got there, another thoughtful touch. The house is always very clean. I’ve stayed in airbnb’s where the floor is sticky, or there’s cob webs in less used areas. This is certainly not the case at Logan’s Guest Nest. We start our visit with the little chalk board in the kitchen welcoming us by name, and end the visit wanting to stay.
Mikki is also very timely in replying to any messages.
We look forward to returning to Sheboygan and will continue stay at Logan’s Guest Nest.

review_text: What a wonderful place to stay! This home is delightful and was welcoming, friendly, and inviting. It had sufficient cooking supplies to cook our own meals there and had really handy little touches such as fire starters for the fire pit out back and emergency rain ponchos for that rain that can catch us off guard. It had very good wifi signal ( which was a crucial point in our stay). If you stay in the upstairs bedroom you will want to be aware of the narrow stairs that go up there. That said, if you can traverse the stairs it's such a cute and comfy place to be. This home was one of the cleanest I've stayed at. I will definitely stay here again when traveling that direction.

review_text: Another lovely stay at Logan’s Guest Nest! The house is on a lovely street in a very walkable neighborhood. Three of us stayed this last visit, and we had plenty of room. The kitchen has plenty of seating, so we were able to have my son and granddaughter over, who live in the area. Between the two bedrooms and the daybed, we each had our own sleeping space, which is nice when traveling. Allows each traveler to have their own space to unwind. The back deck is another great space to unwind. We didn’t have time for a fire in the fire pit, but we saw there was plenty of wood provided to do so. Was fun to see bean bag boards available too. And, my daughter enjoyed the little table and chairs, and made hamburgers and corn on the play grill. Our go to place when coming to Sheboygan!

review_text: Logan’s Guest Nest is going to be our go to when we come to Sheboygan! Each time we walked in the door, we felt that relaxing feeling of being at home. Such a wonderful thing when traveling. Michelle and Dennis attended to every detail. Nicely decorated and furnished. Snacks, coffee, and even a basket of toys that my granddaughter played with when she and my son stopped over during a walk around the lovely neighborhood. The house was a 5 minute walk from my son’s, and we were lucky enough to have great weather, so could do a lot of walking. The bathrooms had everything you needed, with nice water pressure in the shower. Black out curtains in the main level bedroom were nice. Everything was spotless from top to bottom. If you’re coming to Sheboygan, this is the house to stay in. It perfectly represents the feeling of coming home that Sheboygan as a city has to offer.

name: Julia
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We just loved Logan's Nest! Sheboygan is a fun community to explore. We checked out two delicious bakeries: City Bakery and Johnston's. Faye's Pizza was so good we ordered out from there twice in two days. 3 Sheeps was the reason we chose Sheboygan and did not disappoint. The Gameboard board game store was a delightful find with friendly and fun staff. Even though it was March and chilly we still enjoyed beach time at Harbor Center Marina. It was fun to see the surfers thoroughly enjoying the waves! And the Nest was a lovely home base and super clean. Like really clean. Not just saying that. We loved the upper bedroom - steep stairs but a cozy, warm, delightful space! The downstairs living room, bedroom, updated bathroom, and kitchen were perfect for our family of four. I appreciated the updated binder of area info that was provided. Mikki clearly pours love into each space. It was a windy March weekend so a backyard s'more roast in the portable fire pit didn't happen even though we came prepared. Next time!

name: Julie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Nest exceeded all of our expectations. The place was sparkling clean in every corner. We felt completely safe staying here, even though it is regularly booked. There were many thoughtful touches throughout the home to make us feel welcome, including very clear directions for any of the home details such as laundry or the thermostat. We were celebrating a birthday and she even bought a small gift to help with our celebration. The house decor added to the charm without being overdone. Every room was warm and welcoming with good use of color and furniture. We were only scheduled to be there for a weekend, but we could have stayed a month due to how comfortable we felt. The location was great for our hiking, wineries, art, and local flavor. Mikki was quick to respond to our request for a good fish fry but then gave us the space we needed. I cannot recommend this place enough. Book it now!

name: Amy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2020
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We really enjoyed our long weekend at Logan’s Nest. There were so many thoughtful touches: fun toys for the kids (for inside and outside play), snacks on table and in the fridge, marshmallows and fire starters for the fire pit on the counter, and a note welcoming us. We enjoyed eating dinner on the back deck, eating breakfast on the front porch, and making s’mores on the fire pit. She had plenty of fans to get good airflow (it can get a little stuffy upstairs as the lake breeze comes from the window away from the bed, but we chained some of her fans together, which kept it nice and cool during our stay). The location is close to beaches and the downtown (10 minutes or less). It was 20 minutes from Kohler-Andrae State Park (we visited there twice during our stay). We would definitely visit again!

name: David
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Our stay exceeded our expectations, despite the uncooperative weather. Our hosts showcased exceptional flexibility and accommodation, ensuring our comfort throughout our visit. The highlight for our mornings was the breathtaking sunrise, a serene moment we cherished daily. The thoughtful provision of Legos, cars, and an assortment of board games was a delightful surprise, keeping our children and the entire family entertained during those times we preferred the coziness of our temporary home.
The beach, merely a step away, offered a unique charm against the lingering winter chill in late March, proving to be a serene escape. Beyond the immediate beauty and entertainment provided, we found the surrounding area to be rich with activities and sights, all within a convenient 10-15 minute journey. From local eateries to cultural landmarks, there was no shortage of experiences to enrich our stay.

,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We had a little cold front move in right at the start of our stay and a little bit of rain as well. Despite the weather, we had an amazing time as a family. Everything was really clean and well thought out. The house was clearly designed to maximize the space while allowing us all(family of 5) to still feel close-by and connected. We spent 3 nights at the house and felt like it was the perfect amount of time to recharge and refuel. There are a number of eating options close by so we didn't have to waste space packing food and snacks for our kids. Our favorite parts of the trip were playing the many games available in the upstairs loft, while looking out the well placed window at the beach, and walking up towards the resort to the north along the beach. Ideal vacation for families that want to relax and enjoy one anothers' company. We will visit again. Thank you!

review_text: I would stay again! What a beautiful (recently renovated) waterfront home. My family had a delightful time making memories inside & outside. It was nice to have yard space before hitting the sand for the kiddos to play safely. We utilized the firepit and the outdoor shower, more than once each. Thank you for having a packnplay, it was helpful to not tote ours. I really appreciated the PDF you sent of info prior to our stay, very helpful. It even included recommendations of local food. The view from the upstairs window, overlooking the lake was my favorite, especially at sunrise.

The day we were to exist the residence, a rainstorm came in. Although Rebecca could not accommodate us to stay another day she was very understanding and gracious. She let us keep our motorcycles in the driveway until we were to resolve how to get them back to IL. We recommend this location without any reservation.

review_text: Great home, perfect location, fun town! The house is big enough for a family of 5 yet small enough to keep an eye on all of the kids- especially if younger like ours! The backyard is huge and we had bonfires and fun playing bags. The beach is steps away straight out the backyard and everyday was spent playing in the sand and water and building giant moats and castles. Beds were comfy, bathrooms nice, and the kitchen is great for cooking meals or enjoying board/card games at the kitchen table. Loved the record player and extensive record collection! Sheboygan was a fun area to explore with marina walks, Bookworm Gardens, the Aviation Center of Wisconsin, South Parlor Ice Cream, Freaktoyz, and the Music Boxx record store! Great restaurants around, too! Definitely a fun summer getaway!

This house is absolutely beautiful. Very clean and is set up so nicely for memorable days and nights at the beach. The owners have been so thoughtful in making sure their guests have everything they need to make their stay will be fun, easy and comfortable. The outdoor shower is amazing and such a great idea for lake living.
Guests should know that the beach itself is not private and can be very busy especially on hot days. Lots of foot traffic, people with dogs off their leashes and unfortunately smokers leaving their cigarette butts on the sand. Most certainly not a reflection of the owners or their obvious love and respect for the water but none the less needs to be noted for future travelers.

There is an Alexa in the house as well which was an added benefit, providing our group with music throughout the day. The beach was sandy, the surf was mild, the water was warm for Lake Michigan. We were able to have a fire together at night to roast marshmallows as well which added to the memories made on our mini vacation. The beds were very comfortable and linen's were clean and soft. Minutes away is a cute ice cream shop on a board walk along the water. The beach house was the perfect space for our sister-in-law beach get away with kids!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We had tickets for the Pats/Packers game this past weekend and we were trying to find a good spot to stay for a couple days. Sheboygan isn’t necessarily close to Green Bay, but it made sense based on the ridiculous rates for stays up by the stadium. Ellen was great from the first time we touched base upon booking. She gave a great recommendation for using the Packers Discovery Bus charter the day of the game (great call!!), and she made sure the fire pit had plenty of wood available to use (which we were so excited about but didn’t end up making a fire!). Check in was easy, the area is quiet, and everything inside had a modern feel while respecting the original character of the home. Zero complaints whatsoever, we would highly recommend booking with Ellen if you are in town. Many thanks Ellen, and although we probably won’t be in Sheboygan again for a while (Pats play there once every 8 years), we would def book again. Thank you

review_text: This is my 3rd or 4th time back, and it's so convenient to everywhere. We tried out the sushi place across the street, and were really wowed for the low price (we got like 3x the food for what it would have cost in Minneapolis, and liked all of it). It's nice that the new Slo Food Market has a coffeeshop and delicious, and we also tried the John Michael Kohler Art Center Cafe for the first time, and liked that, too (always love the museum). The weather was weird, so we didn't bring bikes, but rentable scooters popped up on April 1st, and we had a great time riding those to 3 Sheeps Brewery (our favorite drinks were the version of The Wolf with coffee, chocolate, and vanilla, and the Strawberry Guava sour)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Being our first time to Sheboygan, we didn’t know what to expect in the middle of Winter. What did we get? An amazing getaway weekend that we left feeling recharged and rested after a holiday weekend. The hosts were great and we are happy with our stay. The location is literally smack in the middle of everything you would want within reach - restaurants, groceries, coffee, and who would wanna miss out on FreakToyz! That place is a can’t miss! While it was 10 degrees on the first night, the warm coziness of the space melted that frozen thoughts away! For those looking to hike and explore, the Lighthouse and state parks are just a short drive away and the countryside is gorgeous! Harry’s Diner was a blast from the 50’s and their team are really welcoming! We are now thinking about coming back for Summer and try surfing Lake Michigan!

review_text:
This is a second floor apartment on 8th street above the surf shop. Make sure to have some coffee and a keto donut at the Whisk bakery nearby.
This is an over 100 year old building with three apartments recently put on the second floor. The build out is relatively economical and there's a note on the refrigerator asking you to take out your trash and take the sheets off your bed when you leave.
I enjoyed the sleeping alcove and was able to get the apartment very dark which helped me sleep better. The wi-fi has a very bright light in it, so bring a piece of black tape to cover it up if you like to sleep in a dark room.
For a modest additional feel the host may be willing to let additional small children stay there and supply an air mattress and additional bedding, so ask for that if that is something you might want.
I would certainly stay here again or recommend it to family or friends.

"The Elbow" is a very cute, cozy and charming little gem! While not overly big it has everything you could need for your stay.
The host reached out to us about the wifi being slow and gave us info on how to try a different account.
There were books to read, surfing picture type books and board games, and a wooden puzzle to keep you entertained after returning from a day of exploring.
The hosts have a folder with various restaurants and some activities you can do.
It is located right on 8th street which you can find a lot of things to do. Lots of fabulous restaurants, coffee places, and bars.
The SSH is located right next the Sly's, a very busy bar but we never were distributed by noise.
I would highly recommend SSH for your next visit to Sheboygan!!!!

name: Angie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Loved it! Perfect main street location for anyone hoping to bike or walk around town, especially by the lakefront. Great food and coffee available nearby at field to fork (easy to get menu items made vegan) and slo food market (if you want to cook yourself). Also shoutout to being close to z spot (great coffeeshop) and paradigm (great coffeeshop with vegan food and entertainment), which I didn't get to stop at this time, but loved when I lived in the area. Easy bike ride to a new favorite this trip--3 sheeps brewing's new location! Excellent craft beer. Easy walk to superior discount liquors, where I always stock up when I'm in town, because they have lower prices and some craft beers that aren't sold in Minnesota. Stopped at the new John Michael Kohler Arts Preserve on this trip, and highly recommend checking that out, along with the even closer original location, and several art pieces placed along the same street as this Airbnb (all free!). Overall, this Airbnb had the perfect location and a cute style, and I will probably rent this or one of their adjoining units if available next time I'm in town. We parked the car in the provided lot (which is also the greyhound station!) and didn't need to use it the whole trip.

name: Karina
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The apartment did not meet our expectations. There were extra rules that needed to be followed that were not addressed prior to us booking. More transparency for future guests is ideal. Host was clear that place needed to be left "as it was found" upon departure and one could not wear shoes in the apartment, with this request, we expected a clean apartment. Spider webs behind the fridge, under the bed/couch and on the ceiling. Dusty areas around the apartment that were immediately addresed with host. Host was quick to respond and gave us the option of sending the cleaning crew to rectify this issue which we did not take. Host reimbursed 1/2 of the cleaning fee, but we honestly believe that when a cleaning fee is being charged and a special request to guests advises to leave the apartment "clean" so cleaning crew "can focus on a deep cleaning" after you depart and prepare place for the upcoming guests. One would expect the apartment to be ready for your stay. Host stated this was uncommon, but the dust and spider webs were a result of weeks if not months of not conducting a deep cleaning. Moreover, we encountered 2 incidences where a mid-size group of teenagers were hanging around in the alley smoking weed. Alley wich leads to the parking lot. This was also addressed with host who took immediate action and had teenagers removed from the alley. Furthermore, prior to booking, we were aware that there are a few bars/restaurants around and loud music will definetely be present, what we didn't expect was for the noise to be present until 5:30 a.m. One night, noise turned into an argument which resulted in a tv being thrown out of an apartment and landed in the alley. Moreover, sofa bed was extremely uncomfortable and hard. Additionally, wifi was super slow. Watching a movie on netflix was difficult due to poor internet signal. We didn't cancel because we were not going to get reimbursed due to the cancellation policy in place. In a more positive note, a variety of restaurants, stores and bars are within walking distance and lake is within driving distance. Overall, our personal experience was not a good one and are aware that there are things that cannot be controlled by the host, but we do hope that host takes into consideration our feedback to make an overall positive experience for future guests.

review_text:
My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Elbow for a week. We were in the area to try the food, outdoor fun, and faire Sheboygan has to offer.
Although the weather did not cooperate, the Elbow offered the perfect oasis for our time in town.
The space is decorated with a classy, trendy vibe and cleverly laid out. It may seem small in pics but feels very spacious and welcoming.
The location is absolutely perfect for any lake or river activities you may have planned. There are many restaurants and pubs within walking distance. The space also includes a parking pass so if you have a vehicle, it’s easily accessed for a drive up the lakefront or a quick jaunt into Milwaukee.
Very pleased with the space and hosts.

There also was no extra toilet paper, just the one roll (we didn't need more then that, but a backup would have been nice just in case). Cute places to shop and eat all within walking distance and just the shores of Lake Michigan are just blocks away. Extra little bonus was the Aveda product! It's nice to use some good products at an Airbnb! Loved staying, Sheboygan is great! :)

They had access to Netflix and a few other on demand programs which was a great way to wind down at the end of the day.
We would definitely recommend it.

review_text:
The Sheoygan Foodie Flat was a fantastic find! We were able to slip away for a quick overnight before heading to Kohler Water Spa the next day and checking into this flat was the perfect start to a lovely Anniversary getaway.
It is clear that Kim and Jason take great pride in investing in a space that is inviting and decorated like a an HGTV magazine, not to mention EXTREMELY clean!!! It has literally everything, including stocked snacks and healthy breakfast options to enjoy a relaxing morning. Not to mention the wide variety of coffee to jump start the day!
Kim was so friendly and helpful, even leaving a personalized note wishing us a happy anniversary upon arrival. She was also available for Restaurant recommendations after we checked out!
I only wish we could have stayed longer to experience even more of what the Foodie Flat offered! I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a place to relax and be close to all that Shebogan and Kohler offer!

review_text:
A+ stay!
Kim and Jason were just the most welcoming hosts ever! Their place was super comfortable and welcoming. The place was pristine and so cutely decorated. We felt right at home and had everything needed!
The apartment was well stocked with everything you'd need. We also appreciated the snack welcome box with excellent chocolate, and stocked fridge with fresh fruit, butter, and milk. We bought some coffee for the drip machine but ended up using the Keurig pods provided because they were so convenient.
The beds were comfy and the shower was really nice. Having laundry in the unit was super convenient. We stayed during some of the hottest days in Sheboygan, over 90 degrees, and we were still very comfortable in the unit.
Kim and Jason were just the best. Super friendly and great communication. I really appreciated their local food recommendations (and second getting the mozzeralla al forno at Trattoria Stefano!)
My husband already stated how we have to go back and stay again!

My husband and my niece and I stayed here for 4 nights. We absolutely loved it. Very comfortable home with a well stocked kitchen and incredible beach access. We kept windows open and enjoyed listening to the waves. One bedroom has a window AC unit. Ceiling fans and lake breezes in both bedrooms and living room kept things perfectly comfortable.
Excellent host communication.
Sheboygan is a great place to visit. Highly recommend Kohler Andrae State Park. The Sheboygan Farmers Market is really nice.
It’s a town with a nice balance of enough to do along with giving yourself some downtime to relax and enjoy the beauty of the lake. Great areas nearby for bird watchers.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Our young family of 4 had a lovely week in this unit, which we used as a base for laid-back beach/playground/eating explorations around Sheboygan, as well as for easy access to the IndyCar race days at Road America. The unit is charmingly decorated, extremely well stocked, an easy walk/drive to everything in town, and very clean. Our host was communicative and clear before and during the stay, and the check-in binder was very helpful. The king size bed was super comfortable. We loved waking up to the views and sounds of the lake just steps away and watching happy park & beachgoers enjoy the area during the evenings. There were little touches to make sure our two young boys were included and comfortable, too. The heat/air-conditioning in the unit took a bit of figuring out - the week we were there went from unseasonably cool to record heat - and we had to experiment with the non-centralized units a bit, but it worked out. Thank you for a wonderful "home" for our first vacation in 3 years!

The house is only 10 min from Kohler-Andre park with beautiful hikes. Easy parking, easy check in/check out. Lisa was very accommodating and super quick to respond, but also not at all intrusive. The house was very clean and we felt comfortable and safe, even during Covid. I would definitely stay here again.

Enough extra blankets and pillows are in the closet.
They have a strong wifi, I had no problem working and streaming Netfilx there.
View is amazing. You can see lake right at the window, beautiful and peaceful scenery. Beach is in walking distance, like 2 minutes away, my daughter went there few times a day to play with sand. Soft, beautiful sand. Weather was little cold for play outside, I will book here again during the summer so we can spend more time at the beach.
It was perfect weekend getaway.
Jesse was the nicest host ever. She helped me so much, we had little trouble with our car and she went extra mile and beyond. She answered all the questions in second, recommended me a good auto repair places. I bothered her a lot because I don't have anybody but her and she was so friendly and nice.
One of the best Airbnb stay ever!

review_text:
This place was exactly what we were looking for three of us on a mother-daughter get away. It suited us perfectly! The amenities exceeded our expectations. Everything we needed, we were able to find, making our stay very convenient and refreshing. In each room, it was evident that the hosts have VERY thoughtfully prepared their property to anticipate and accommodate the needs of the guests. Jesse was very responsive and so gracious to accommodate a few extra needs and special requests from us, which was above and beyond what she would have needed to do. The condo is very clearly well maintained and cared for. Even in the winter, while we weren't able to take full advantage of the beach and lake access, the views of the lake were still so breathtaking.
I'm so glad we chose this place - we have no regrets, and would book again in a heartbeat. It couldn't have been a more comfortable stay. The ONLY downer of our stay was that we had to leave! We would love to come back next time we're in the Sheboygan area.
I will note that while there are many perks of staying in a ground level unit, it does come the trade off of footsteps and muffled voices from above. For us it was not too distracting or bothersome, and it certainly wasn't constant - just something to be aware of for someone who may be more sensitive to that.

Stayed about a week
review_text: Waves of Happiness is a perfect name for this Airbnb! The unit it self was great...clean- newly renovated- loaded with everything you need for a home away from home! And decorated very "beachy"...Also literally just minutes from many points of interest in Sheboygan. Communication was fast and excellent! The location was wonderful; very quiet street. LOVE LOVE LOVED being so close to the water. This was our first time to one of the Great Lakes and it felt, looked and sounded exactly like we were at the ocean! Great water views from both the front and back porches! Beach chairs were provided...the water was too cold (for us anyway) in October to swim. But we got our feet wet and took a nap on the beach several times. Enjoyed our coffee and the waves every morning on the back porch. The bedroom with the queen bed has a glass door that goes to the back porch...I discovered on our last day that it also has a "roll away" screen!!! Would not hesitate to stay at here again! Sheboygan is a very neat town with lots of history. THANK YOU Jesse and Brenda!!!

Run don’t walk to check out this property! We had an incredible long weekend and thoroughly enjoyed so many aspects of the Airbnb and the town.
The Airbnb itself was super clean and comfortable. Jesse and Brenda provided us with tons of suggestions and were easy to get ahold of. The bed was super comfortable and the fridge was stocked with local treats, including some dog biscuits from a nearby pet store!
We LOVED the proximity to the beaches and took advantage of that basically every day. They weren’t crowded and the hosts provided us with beach chairs and mats. We also sat on the porch every morning and enjoyed the lake sounds with coffee.
Coming from Chicago, we found Sheboygan to be quaint and quiet but a lovely way to reconnect with nature and each other.
We will absolutely be coming back!

name: Amber
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: My first long term stay was at Stephanie’s place. I chose it for the location, ability to work remotely, and affordability. Stephanie put a lot of thought into making the place warm and welcoming for guests. In addition to normal amenities, there was a washer and dryer with detergent and dryer sheets, loads of kitchen supplies, plenty of storage space, and a private outdoor patio. The location was great with plenty of walkable restaurants and a couple grocery markets. I enjoyed Delano park many afternoons. It’s ~15 min walk, but I drove to maximize time walking with the lake view. It’s also an easy day drip to Door County or Milwaukee. This is next to the fire station, so I heard sirens maybe once a day which isn’t bad especially being in a city. The steps coming up to the apartment were a bit shallow/steep which made it a little harder when carrying things, but they are indoors and there’s a handrail. The parking lot was convenient. Stephanie was very responsive. Would recommend!

review_text: I have stayed at many, MANY Airbnbs over the past decade -- and never have I felt more comfortable than I did here. The clever combination of the old and the new really resonated with me! The bed was super-comfy, I LOVED having a separate office, and -- even though the weather wasn't particularly cooperative, the balcony was an extra added attraction. Having Stephanie downstairs at the MiniMocha Play Cafe was another plus: I could just walk in the door (take your shoes off!!) to talk with her about any questions, concerns or compliments (lots of those!!)

review_text: We love staying at this air b&b when we are in Sheboygan visiting family - this was our second visit and we plan on staying here again in the future. We only stayed for 2 nights but I could see this being a perfect place to stay for a longer visit. It is very spacious, private, quiet, spotlessly clean and the bed is very comfortable. Gorgeous vintage details like high ceilings, wood floors, arched doorways. Love the potbelly stove in the living room. TV in both the bedroom and living room. The outdoor area with table and chairs is a nice touch. The kitchen has a full sized refrigerator, rangetop, microwave, toaster, toaster oven and kitchen conveniences. Well stocked with coffee and tea. There’s even a washer and dryer. Lots of interesting artwork and books speaking to the history of the area.

reviews are pretty straight forward "did you get what you paid for" OR a simple fill in the blanks of Y/N.
this is really BOTH. getting what you paid for. Absolutely YES. knowing all about the History of a Wonderful town of Sheboygan NO. Not until you step inside this amazing place with wonderful FACT and artifacts of the History of this wonderful Building so tastefully set to the TIME when things were, the way they were!!! you can feel the vibe right when you press unlock on the keypad, the decor was set Back in time with an amazing rustic feel for what really was. Great Job on feeling the Home with the times. beautiful place, neat setting and awesome walkabout places to go and see and rest the feet in a nice place to eat. Truely an amazing overnight stay for 2. Thank You

review_text:
We booked our stay to do an Executive Retreat & celebrate the end of 2022 for our small business. This space has absolutely everything you need to relax away from home and work if you need to: comfy bed, extremely clean space, well stocked kitchen (there’s even a Keurig!), good wifi, a mini Bluetooth speaker, a printer, they really thought of everything!
We also love that it’s within walking distance to the lake, Stefano’s, and the new SloFood market which has a great upscale selection of wine, cheese, meats, chocolates and lots of easy to take home food.
I hope to return in the summer when it’s swimming weather. Sheboygan beaches are beautiful.
Last, I also loved the interior design of the space. I wouldn’t mind living in a home decorated like this. The heated floor in the bathroom is my new obsession for my future home.

The heated floor in the bathroom is amazing, all the light switches were labeled, every nice little amenity you could think of was provided (unscented laundry pods & dryer sheets, extra cozy blanket, k-cups, coloring books and cards, blackout shades, bottle opener, seriously everything we needed). The guest book also had lots of great locals spots to try and Stephanie is the sweetest person. I would 100% recommended to someone looking for a place to stay.

I was travelling in Wisconsin on business and chose this place for its central location for where I was going. The apartment has a lot of charm and comfort and for a business traveler, the quiet was very nice.
The dining is very good and accessible by walking, which is also a perk when you are driving all day.
Thanks, Stephanie!

Stayed with kids
review_text: Great experience! The location is terrific -- really close to the main strip of shops and restaurants. The apartment itself is nicely decorated, clean and has a great layout; the work/bedroom area in the back is well-distanced from the front living, dining and kitchen areas. Both ends of the unit have a lot of natural light. The rooftop patio is a really cool feature that sets this apart from similar rentals. Most importantly, Stephanie has clearly put a lot of thought and effort into making it a positive experience for visitors. Nicely equipped, maintained and clean. I'd absolutely stay here again and am even more likely to visit the area knowing this unit is available.

name: Tomas
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This gorgeous loft apartment home is everything you will look for in your Airbnb stay. Sheboygan is a lovely town to begin with, and this place encompasses all the charm, nostalgia, and historical touches you would hope for. Stephanie is a conscientious host, providing things like make up removal towelettes to save her ultra soft white washcloths from ladies black mascara. The bedding, blankets, towels are all first rate. The bathroom is so beautifully Art Deco designed, I have asked her to share with us the materials she used as we are in the process of building and I want my guest baths to look like hers! The shower is a spa experience, the outdoor patio and deck the ultimate space to unwind, and you’ll find bits of history and nostalgia every time you turn around. Everything about our stay here was perfect. Thank you - Erin and Tom.

review_text: What a gem! Stephanie’s place is impeccably clean and has the feel of a boutique hotel but with more privacy and space. Easy check-in and out, responsive hosts, and the location was perfect. So many good dining options within walking distance, we were able to dine outside for all of our meals and even brought some takeout home to our little rooftop terrace. A short drive to the dunes and beaches at Kohler Andrae state park was the perfect summer send off. We can’t wait to return!

I loved having a washer and dryer with all the amenities one could offer. The location was wonderful as you are so close awesome restaurants and delicatessens. Although Lake Michigan can be cold most of the year, it was perfect water temperature when we went and thoroughly enjoyed the beach. This is an excellent Airbnb and would definitely stay here again!

review_text:
The pictures don’t do this place justice. Very comfortable bed and pillows. It is in a safe location and easy to walk to everything downtown. Couldn’t ask for anything more.
The space feels much larger than a typical one bedroom. Please set expectations, the kitchen is small and only has a two burner stove, but that was all we needed.
The living room was large, there were plenty of closets and a separate desk for work time. The outdoor table/chairs was a bonus on the outdoor deck. What a pleasant surprise. Can’t wait to visit again.

Stayed with kids
review_text: You will not want to pass this place up. The outdoor patio was incredible. The place is actually way bigger feeling than the pictures show. The bed is more comfy than the one that I have at home which is insane for a Airbnb! In the heart of downtown being 10-15 minutes from two beaches and 5-10 minutes from endless food options… this place is a hidden gem! Cannot say enough about how amazing Stephanie is either. She had a high chair and bib ready for us and a pack and play for our son to sleep in. She let us join a crew and the cafe downstairs with 48 hour notice. We can’t wait to come back.

name: Danny
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was perhaps the best Airbnb we've stayed at. The apartment was new and very clean. Also, the decor was impressive and comforting, with an artistic nod to the local history. You can tell the host had spent a lot of time and care in designing and furnishing the apartment. She was also quick to respond and accommodating. The location is on a quiet street and just down the block from the main drag of shops, restaurants and pubs. The apartment is up a flight of stairs, but didn't have a problem with that, even after a long day of sightseeing and walking. We hope to stay at this Airbnb each time that we visit Sheboygan.
